meanings.definition: The state of being reserved or introverted.
meanings.sent1: Her withdrawnness made it difficult for her to make new friends.
meanings.sent2: His withdrawnness often led others to think he was unfriendly.
meanings.sent3: Despite his withdrawnness, he still managed to charm everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The withdrawnness of the cat added to its mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The withdrawnness of the forest enveloped her in a sense of solitude.

meanings.definition: The act of removing oneself from a situation or group.
meanings.sent1: His sudden withdrawnness from the meeting surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: She decided to show her withdrawnness by leaving the party early.
meanings.sent3: The magician's withdrawnness from the stage left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The withdrawnness of the student council president shocked the school.
meanings.sent5: The withdrawnness of the ship captain saved the crew from danger.

meanings.definition: The quality of being distant or aloof.
meanings.sent1: The withdrawnness of the professor made it hard for students to approach him.
meanings.sent2: Her withdrawnness in social situations often made others feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The withdrawnness of the mountain peak gave it an air of majesty.
meanings.sent4: The withdrawnness of the CEO made employees hesitant to speak up.
meanings.sent5: The withdrawnness of the moon added to its enigmatic beauty.
